description.html:
@hsu and I have rewritten the Optitrack pose math to calibrate the pose of tracked objects relative to the axes of the monitor, not the hardcoded axes we were previously relying on. This way, the Gazebo axes match up directly with the plane created by the monitor, and the Optitrack configuration should not get messed up based on movements of the monitor or the camera.

If you're curious about the pose math, please consult us for a whiteboarding session. We are working on a way of conveying a pose math tree into the documentation.

Please note that right now Optitrack commands the model positions in a local frame, not a global frame like the Hydra or Polhemus. A future PR will use the "local frame" radio button to toggle between local and global control.

title.raw: Issue #73: Optitrack marker arithmetic based on monitor axes
title.html: Issue #73: Optitrack marker arithmetic based on monitor axes
